text: Woah - hope your exams are going well!! How are you feeling about them so far?
Fingers crossed for you! I'm sure you'll do amazing

Salary for physiotherapist is mentioned here >> <https://www.prospects.ac.uk/job-profiles/physiotherapist> (so starting at roughly £24-30k when you get qualified, moving up towards £60-75k!) Of course if you work for sports teams/other high-profile clients etc you could probably make a lot more than that, so definitely not bad at all!

attachments.title: Physiotherapist job profile | Prospects.ac.uk
attachments.text: Discover what it takes to be a Physiotherapist. Find out expected salary, working hours, qualifications and more.

text: That's great you're thinking about Medicine and physio courses. It's perfectly fine to apply for different courses, but of course you usually only do one Uni application /personal statement letter so it will make it very hard to make the personal statement relevant and effective if you are applying for maths at one uni and english in another!! ... it's also good to show you are passionate about a particular area, as thats more believable than saying you are passionate about 5 completely different areas!
Thats really good about Imperial not caring about GCSEs. You have great experience already on your CV so youre in with a chance to impress!
I have a question: why did you choose Brunel University?
Can definitely help you with your personal statement when the time comes - you have a very solid CV which will be super helpful!
So far not bad, could have done better though, thank you!! When it talks about bands, how do you go up a band? Does it like depend on you many worth of experience you've had?
These are the league tables for physiotherapy (notice Robert Gordon is near the top? thats why she choose it!) <https://www.thecompleteuniversityguide.co.uk/league-tables/rankings/physiotherapy>

attachments.title: Physiotherapy - Top UK University Subject Tables and Rankings 2020
attachments.text: League tables of the best universities for Physiotherapy, 2020. Compare universities, courses, prospects and career options.
attachments.fallback: Physiotherapy - Top UK University Subject Tables and Rankings 2020

text: I wanted to stick around London (Where my family are from) but then realise the best uni for Business was in Bath so I went there at the last minute haha
Oh yeh I was literally checking this yesterday haha
Yeah so you go up salary bands when you get promoted (typically every 1 or 2 years)
So yes in a way it depends on experience but also how quickly you progress in your job and impress your seniors :wink:
I guess I'll make medicine at Imperial as my first choice, but chose different unis for physio as the rest of the 4
Yeah I would say because Imperial is very competitve you should make your personal statement around that a lot as you want to give yourself the best chance / strongest application
What grades are you expecting? I thought I had asked already but cant find it!

I chose brunel because they have a pretty good reputation for physio and its quite close to where I live, I really don't want to travel hours for my uni and I'm not allowed to move either. Woah, did you live alone or with feiends?

Yeh right, depending on how I do throughout the year I'll decide if medicine is for me, I've seen some medical students complaining about the workload and how it doesn't get easier. As time is going, I don't know why but I want to do physiotherapy more and more haha
It sounds so interesting to the point I feel like starting it already, I just wish they provide a placement year or something so it gives a head start to the career
We haven't been given the grades that we will be expecting yet, but I muslef think it will be something like ABB or AAB (B being chem:face_with_rolling_eyes:)
I have also started researching about physiotherapy places, hopefully I'll contact them within this week to see if they have any work placements
I need to head out quickly (am currently in the US!) so will reply to you later :smiley:
Wow that souns amazing!! Sure, tell me how it was when you're free, Good luck have a safe flight:grin::grin::grin:
